thread.title: Habs sign Plekanec to two-year extension | Hockey | Sports | Toronto Sun
thread.title_full: Habs sign Plekanec to two-year extension | Hockey | Sports | Toronto Sun

author: torontosun.com
title: Habs sign Plekanec to two-year extension | Hockey | Sports | Toronto Sun
text:
Off to an impressive 5-0 start to the new season, the Montreal Canadiens have successfully taken care of some off-ice business as well.
Coming off a 2-0 victory over the New York Rangers in their home opener Friday, the Habs announced Friday that veteran Tomas Plekanec has been signed to a two-year contract extension.
The new deal is reportedly worth $12 million, breaking down into $7 million for 2016-17 and $5 million for 2017-18.
Plekanec, 32, is in the final season of a six-year, $30-million contract. Last season Plekanec finished second in team scoring behind now-captain Max Pacioretty with 26 goals and 36 assists for 60 points.
Thus far in 2015-16, Plekanec has four goals in five games.
